questions.text: A 6-year-old girl underwent an ultrasonography for recurring abdominal pain. The scan revealed a horse-shoe kidney without any other abnormalities. The stool examination revealed Giardia. The girl was given Anti-Giardial medication and she responded to the treatment. Which statement regarding her horse-shoe kidney is true?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

No treatment needed for horse-shoe kidney

questions.text: A 7 -year-old girl has been brought to the OPD with complaints of urinary incontinence. questions.solution:

questions.text:
All of the following statements regarding radical nephrectomy are true except

questions.solution:

questions.text: A 60-year-old man comes to the OPD with the complaints of decreased stream of urine and intermittent stream. On enquiring he also said that he passes urine 5 times at night and had one episode of hematuria one week back. On examination his Pulse was 80 / min and BP was 170/100. His per abdomen examination was unremarkable and he refused consent for per rectal examination. The blood parameters were Hemoglobin 7.8 g/dl and TLC was 21,000. Blood urea was 70 mg/dl and Serum creatinine 2.2. Blood sugar fasting was 210.Which statement in his management is true?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Patient should be catheterized

questions.text: A 5-year-old boy was brought to the OPD with complaints of absent test in both the scrotum. On examination left testis was not palpable and the right testis was palpable in the right inguinal canal. Which statement out of the following in the management of the child is correct?
